thread.title: 5 Halwas That Are Best Suited For Winters
thread.title_full: 5 Halwas That Are Best Suited For Winters

author: Tejashee Kashyap
title: 5 Halwas That Are Best Suited For Winters
text:
Image Courtesy: Canva
In winter, people often prefer warm and hearty desserts, and certain types of halwa are particularly well-suited for this season.
Image Courtesy: Canva
Here are some types of halwa that are considered best suited for winters:
Image Courtesy: Canva
The rich and hearty Gajar ka Halwa is not only delicious but also provides warmth during the cold season.
Image Courtesy: Canva
Moong Dal Halwa is a popular winter dessert. It has a rich, nutty flavour and a dense texture
Image Courtesy: Canva
Almonds are known for their warming properties, and Badam Halwa is a delightful way to enjoy their goodness
Image Courtesy: Canva
It has a unique, slightly nutty flavor and a dense, satisfying texture.
Image Courtesy: Canva
Also known as Sheera or Rava Kesari, Suji Halwa is another perfect winter dessert.
Image Courtesy: Canva
These halwa varieties are not only delicious but also provide warmth and energy, making them perfect choices for the winter season.
Image Courtesy: Canva
Which of these halwas are your go-to favourites?
Image Courtesy: Canva
